author: Helix Consulting LLC
title: News - 2024/08/16 - Panorama | Armenian news
text: Newsline Web [Turkey blocks access to Instagram](https://www.panorama.am/en/shortNews/2024/08/02/Turkey-Instagram/3036135) Turkey has blocked access to social media platform Instagram, the infotech regulator said on Friday, without stating a reason or duration for the ban, which also left the platform's mobile app inaccessible, [Reuters ](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/turkey-blocks-access-instagram-platform-gives-no-reason-2024-08-02/)reported. The move follows comments on Wednesday by Turkish communications official Fahrettin Altun, criticising the platform for what he called its decision to block condolence posts on the killing of Ismail Haniyeh, a key official of Palestinian militant group Hamas. "This is censorship, pure and simple," Altun, the communications director of the Turkish presidency, said on X, adding that Instagram had not cited any policy violations for its action. There was no immediate comment from Instagram parent Meta Platforms Inc (META.O), opens new tab on either the ban or Altun's comments. Turkey's Information Technologies and Communication Authority (BTK) published the Aug. 2 decision on its website. [France involved in restoration of Tatev monastery, envoy says](https://www.panorama.am/en/shortNews/2024/07/30/France-Tatev-monastery/3035142) France is involved in the restoration project of Big Desert of Tatev, a 17th-century Armenian monastery, French Ambassador to Armenia Olivier Decottignies said on Monday. “Tatev Monastery is one of the jewels of Armenia's cultural heritage and symbolizes the country's identity,” the envoy wrote on X. [Greece welcomes EU's decision to start visa liberalization dialogue with Armenia](https://www.panorama.am/en/shortNews/2024/07/24/Greece-EU-Armenia/3032778) Greece welcomes the EU’s "historic" decision to provide European Peace Facility assistance and launch visa liberalization dialogue with Armenia, the Greek Foreign Ministry said on Wednesday. “Strengthening EU-Armenia Partnership fosters democracy, peace and regional stability,” the ministry said in a post on X. The EU Council on Monday adopted an assistance measure under the European Peace Facility (EPF) in support of the Armenian armed forces worth €10 million. — Υπουργείο Εξωτερικών (@GreeceMFA) [#Greece]welcomes the [#EU]’s historic decision to provide European Peace Facility [#EPF]assistance & launch visa liberalisation dialogue w/ [#Armenia]. Strengthening EU-Armenia Partnership fosters democracy, peace & regional stability. [@MFAofArmenia] [July 24, 2024] [Trump vows to end Ukraine war in call with Zelensky](https://www.panorama.am/en/shortNews/2024/07/20/Trump-Ukraine-war/3031372) US Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said Friday he had spoken by telephone with Ukraine leader Volodymyr Zelensky, and pledged to end the European country's war with Russia, [France 24](https://www.france24.com/en/americas/20240720-trump-speaks-to-zelensky-pledges-to-end-the-war-with-russia) reported. "I appreciate President Zelensky for reaching out because I, as your next President of the United States, will bring peace to the world and end the war that has cost so many lives and devastated countless innocent families," Trump said in a [post ](https://truthsocial.com/@realDonaldTrump/posts/112815440435929028)on his Truth Social platform. "Both sides will be able to come together and negotiate a deal that ends the violence and paves a path forward to prosperity." The United States has provided tens of billions of dollars in military assistance for Kyiv since Russia launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine in February 2022 -- though a Trump victory in the November election would put Washington's continued support into question. Zelensky confirmed the call, during which he congratulated Trump on formally becoming the Republican Party's presidential nominee, as well as wishing the 78-year-old well after an attempt on his life a week ago. "We agreed with President Trump to discuss at a personal meeting what steps can make peace fair and truly lasting," Zelensky said in a post on X. [EUMA hosts Dutch Parliament delegation](https://www.panorama.am/en/shortNews/2024/07/12/EUMA/3028416) The EU Mission in Armenia (EUMA) on Friday hosted a delegation of the Dutch Parliament and Ambassador of the Netherlands to Armenia Jaap Frederiks. "Honoured to host a delegation of the Dutch Parliament and the Ambassador of Netherlands to Armenia, Jaap Frederiks, in EUMA," it said in a post on [X](https://x.com/EUmARMENIA/status/1811667476456825007?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1811667476456825007%7Ctwgr%5E8170aaa2f5d2b119115763530e134ade356463ea%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.azatutyun.am%2Fa%2Fem-arakelutyunn-ijevanum-hyuynkalel-e-niderlandneri-patvirakutyany%2F33033797.html). "The visitors joined a patrol in Ijevan region to learn more about the Mission’s work on the ground. Thank you for your continued support!" EUMA added. [U.S. envoy joins EU mission in Armenia to observe border situation](https://www.panorama.am/en/shortNews/2024/07/11/US-envoy/3027962) U.S. Ambassador to Armenia Kristina Kvien on Thursday joined the European Union Mission in Armenia (EUMA) to observe the situation on the border in the town of Kapan, the U.S. Embassy reported. "The United States welcomes the progress by Armenia and Azerbaijan toward a dignified and durable peace," the embassy said. [Kim Kardashian's woven braids spark Founding Father comparisons](https://www.panorama.am/en/shortNews/2024/06/25/Kim-Kardashian/3021224) Kim Kardashian’s latest hairstyle has seemingly taken inspiration from America’s Founding Fathers, according to fans. The Skims founder, 43, took to Instagram on June 23 to debut a new look. In a carousel of photos, Kardashian’s platinum blonde hair was woven into basket braid pigtails. The reality TV star went makeup free in the photos, pairing her braided hairstyle with a sheer tank top and nude leggings, [The Independent](https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/kim-kardashian-woven-braids-hair-b2568077.html?utm_medium=Social&utm_source=Facebook&fbclid=IwZXh0bgNhZW0CMTEAAR3svvdDOZf2TnZs7SwpQykx_WXkigLPer4h9t4c-jqIqI4PmoKLbaP4kIM_aem_A-BbF_EhZDf3E_jI3vu7tw#Echobox=1719291424) reported. While the Keeping Up with the Kardashians alum has been known to wear some avante-garde and futuristic ensembles, some fans believed her newest look resembled a powdered wig from the 18th century. “What in the constitution is going on here?” one Instagram user commented under the post. “Ok George Washington,” another fan joked. “It’s giving… Founding Father,” said someone else, while another person quipped: “She getting ready to write the Declaration of Independence.” Kardashian’s woven braids were crafted by her longtime hairstylist Chris Appleton, who she tagged in her Instagram post. Appleton posted photos of the entrepreneur’s basket braids to his own Instagram, simply captioning his post with three silver chain link emojis. This isn’t the first time the mother of four has shocked fans with a dramatic hair transformation. In 2015, Kardashian debuted her now-signature bleach blonde hair for the first time at Paris Fashion Week. The Kardashians star went back to her natural dark brown locks on-and-off for several years, before undergoing a 14-hour hair transformation to channel Marilyn Monroe at the 2022 Met Gala. [Kim Kardashian admits she hid in bathroom to escape her sreaming kids](https://www.panorama.am/en/shortNews/2024/06/06/Kim-Kardashian/3012868) Kim Kardashian has revealed she was forced to lock herself in a bathroom to escape the wrath of her four kids, [The Mirror](https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/kim-kardashian-forced-hide-bathroom-32971474) reports. Kim shares her offspring with ex-husband Kanye West. She’s a doting mum to North, 10, Saint, eight, Chicago, six, and Psalm, five. In new scenes from her Disney+ show The Kardashians, the 43-year-old Skims founder admitted she “couldn’t believe” the way her kids were behaving. Sitting in a car while on the way to jury duty, Kim was seen chatting on the phone to an unnamed friend when she began to vent about her children, confessing she was a “push over” when it came to her kids. “Hey can I vent for one sec? It’s been an extra troubling week where I was just like I can’t do it anymore,” Kim began, adding: “I just… anything in that home is just chaotic right now. Oh my God, no, what I wanted to say was I had a Zoom at the house with all my kids there, banging on the door, just screaming, and I was literally hiding in a bathroom with the door locked as I was just like, I can’t believe this. I mean I can believe it, but that’s like my biggest nightmare.” Elaborating on her parenting techniques in a confessional, Kim told cameras: “Sometimes it gets, just like a little intense. I want to be more strict like Khloe but I don’t know why I have a hard time just saying no is no. I think I also just don’t want to deal with the whining and the tears of not getting their way.” “They know when to con me and when to throw the little, you know, start with the tears so I’m like, ‘Stop, stop, sure, take an iPad,’ you know, just stop. I just have to be like, ‘I don’t care if you’re gonna throw a tantrum in front of everyone right now. The answer is no’,” Kim noted. Kim’s family drama comes after she showcased her dramatic weight loss as she slipped into one of Janet Jackson's iconic outfits. The reality star-turned-lawyer purchased Janet's outfit from the iconic 1993 music video for her single, If, three years ago at an auction. Kim spent a whopping $25,000 (£19,571) on the costume back in 2021, explaining she was "such a fan". At the time, Kim took to her Instagram Stories saying: "For @janetjackson's bday bc I'm such a fan I can't believe I won this on juliens_auctions. Happy birthday queen!" [EUMA welcomes visitors from Dutch Police](https://www.panorama.am/en/shortNews/2024/06/04/EUMA/3011796) The EU Mission in Armenia (EUMA) on Monday welcomed the Dutch Police delegation. “Happy to welcome visitors from the Dutch Police today in Yeghegnadzor. Good discussions on EUMA’s mandate and activities on the ground,” EUMA said in a post on [X](https://x.com/EUmARMENIA/status/1797558101757067537?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1797558101757067537%7Ctwgr%5Eaedbfdd4133d784dbde82221880d2080db157672%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fen.armradio.am%2F2024%2F06%2F03%2Feu-mission-in-armenia-welcomes-dutch-police-delegation%2F&mx=2). It expressed gratitude for continued support to the mission. [Armenian Film Festival to be held in Glendale in September](https://www.panorama.am/en/shortNews/2024/05/29/Armenian-Film-Festival-Glendale/3009305) Armenian Film Society’s Armenian Film Festival returns September 4-8, 2024 at LOOK Cinemas in Glendale, California. The inaugural Armenian Film Festival held in 2023 drew in over 1,500 attendees from all over the world, including Armenia, China and the Netherlands, over the course of five days of sold-out screenings. "We can’t wait to welcome you back!" Armenian Film Society [said](https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=1047360370480196&set=a.547937827089122). Film submissions now [open](http://armenianfilmfestival).
